nail.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a thin pointed piece of metal with a flat top, which you hit into a surface with a hammer, for example to join things together or to hang something on
nail.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The key was hanging on a nail by the door.
She hammered a nail into the wall.
nail.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: your nails are the hard smooth layers on the ends of your fingers and toes
nail.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: She sat painting her nails  (=putting a coloured substance on them).
He still had dirt under his nails.
nail.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 2: your nails are the hard smooth layers on the ends of your fingers and toes
nail.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: Her long nails were painted a pearly pink.
Her nails were short and uneven.
How did you get such dirty nails?
His nails were neat and clean.
finger nail
She had small hands with polished finger nails.
toe nail
His toenails were long and dirty.
cut your nails
You should cut your nails more often!
trim your nails
His nails were neatly trimmed.
file your nails
A girl was filing her nails on the bus.
bite your nails
Eddie bit his nails nervously.
paint/polish/varnish your nails
Don't paint short nails in dark colours.
manicure your nails
She had manicured nails and expensive clothes.
do your nails
She sat at her desk, doing her nails.
break a nail
Oh, no, I've broken a nail.
nail.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to fasten something to something else with nails
nail.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: A sign saying ‘No Fishing’ had been nailed to the tree.
The lid was firmly nailed down.
The windows had been nailed up.
nail.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to catch someone and prove that they are guilty of a crime or something bad
nail.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: It took us 10 years to nail the guy who killed our daughter.
The state police finally nailed him for fraud.
nail.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: if you nail something, you succeed in getting it, after a lot of time or effort
nail.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: She finally nailed her dream job.
nail.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to do something perfectly, especially when singing or performing
nail.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: I thought that song might be too big for you, but you absolutely nailed it!
nail.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to catch someone and prove that they are guilty of a crime or of doing something bad
nail.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The government spent vast resources in an unsuccessful effort to nail him on felony charges.
nail.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: if you pay for something on the nail, you pay for it immediately
nail.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: Not paying on the nail could be extremely expensive.
